text:
Temperatures sometimes rise or fall suddenly. For example,

Montana holds the United States record for the fastest rise in temperature over a 24-hour period. In 23 hours, the temperature changed from –54˚F to 49˚F in the town of Loma.

January 14, 1972: 9 am –54˚F → January 15, 1972: 8 am 49˚F

Montana also holds the world record for the fastest fall. Browning, MT, saw temperatures drop from 44°F to –56°F, in less than 24 hours.

January 23, 1916: 9 am 44˚F→ January 24, 1916: 8 am –56˚F

• How many degrees did the temperature rise in Loma, Montana?
  • How many degrees did the temperature fall in Browning, Montana?
  • How could you represent each change on a number line? With an equation?
